The webcam is HD, and perfect for Skyping and FaceTime. The speakers sound good while playing music, and the touchpad is very responsive. The only problem I had about the Macbook Pro, was the premium price, after all there are plenty of PC laptops only $500! But, I think the extra cash was definitely worth it, as Macs tend not to get as buggy as Windows laptops, and usually have a longer lifespan!  Overall very happy about my purchase and can't wait to see what the new Macbook Pro will have to offer (besides the HUGE $2,000 price tag)!

Reviews.Title: Macbook pro
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Awesome!!best deal with amazon.com...Fast shipping!!great laptop for design and music and video editingFast processor , simple design with 13" slim lcdMake this laptop more beautiful with good graphicsNice software from Apple..thanks

Reviews.Title: Best choice eva!
Reviews.Author: gadgets girl
Reviews.Content: I had a macbook than an iPad and gave those away but this, i will never give away. Ive been a mac lover and user for many years... This is one of the  best products ever made.

Reviews.Title: Wayyy Fun
Reviews.Author: V. Schmidt "blue9112"
Reviews.Content: I got mine at the Apple Store in Tampa, but wanted to say why did I wait so long? My old PowerBook is still alive, but slowly fading, and I cannot function without a dependable computer. Have been a Mac fan for 20 years, and, after getting the PowerBook, would never have another desktop system. They don't use the term laptop anymore, so my MacBook Pro is a notebook, with a smaller screen than I am used to, but with the little gesture to enlarge any image anywhere, that shouldn't be a problem.For me, the BEST feature is the slicker trackpad. For the time being, I am going back and forth between the new and old machines, and I had thought my PowerBook was the height of elegance and ease of use, but after acclimating to the very slick trackpad on the MacBook Pro, going back to the old laptop seems so sluggish, and the trackpad actually seems cumbersome and sticky. Listen, even though I do actual work on my computer, I am on it almost all day long and spend quite a bit of unproductive time playing games. I have played solitaire for so long without a break that my fingertips felt raw. That was the old machine...I don't think that can happen with the Pro.

Reviews.Title: I made the switch because of the software
Reviews.Author: Diane Kistner
Reviews.Content: Okay, let me tell you, I'd had it with Microsoft products. I mean, really really had it. Had it so bad that I had been painstakingly switching everything I could to either webware or open-source software. It was better, but still all of my Windows-based laptops have been major pains; so when Microsoft acquired (and promptly trashed) my main connection to the world (Skype) that was absolutely the last straw.Knowing there was no way on my low fixed income I could ever buy anything other than a cheap tablet, I started shifting my thinking toward cloud-based computing. I got things lean and mean. I set up free cloud storage and put my most important files (books our small press has on CreateSpace and KDP) online. I even ditched my PC-based email for Gmail on the web. I made a major commitment to undergoing a huge learning curve, in other words, and to breaking my entrenched Windows habits.Then my incredible, wonderful, thoughtful, generous, thoroughly amazing sister bought me this MacBook Pro and installed her remaining legal Adobe CS5 on it! She then turned me loose with "Macbeth," as I named it ("Beth" for short). Soon I had Mac versions of all my other important software installed, all but You Need A Budget (YNAB) - Personal Finance Software (an awesome program I cannot afford to repurchase in Mac format). I soon found mint.com, and that did the trick in the financial department.What can I say? I love it. Love it love it love it. Everything is better, faster, quieter, easier, prettier, sexier. The keyboard is a little stiffer than I've been used to, but it's loosening up with use. The screen has a mirror-glass finish, which I'm not sure I like, but if I have the lighting adjusted properly in the room, I don't notice it.I LOVE that this laptop does not get hot; it's just a little warmish on the bottom, unlike my PCs which got frightfully hot. The only time I'm aware at all of anything going on in the system is when I've got a CD in the drive. Then it's "rackety," if you know what I mean, and I'm not entirely convinced that's the way it's supposed to be. (I haven't put any CD in the drive with any kind of stuck-on label on it, and I would strongly advise against doing that.) The battery holds up really well so I can take Beth in to the living room when I'm watching TV at night and not worry about running out of juice before bedtime.I LOVE the trackpad. It is large, and you can tap anywhere on it to effect movement. The gestures are easy to learn (like single-finger tap for left click, double-finger tap for right-click, and three-finger dragging if you've set it up that way in your preferences), and I feel like I'm in training for the tablet I'm going to have one day. The only thing that isn't faster/easier than using the mouse is quickly moving the cursor from one side of the screen all the way to the other side, which sometimes involves lifting my finger and then re-dragging. There may be a trick to click-and-drag I haven't figured out yet, but when I'm trying to click-and-drag for any distance, it's more difficult than when using a mouse. As with Windows, there is a way to disable the trackpad if you are using a mouse, but unlike with my PC-based trackpads, this Mac trackpad does not often respond when I brush across it while typing so I leave it active.Here's what I haven't gotten used to yet:The Command keys are placed on either side of a very narrow-width spacebar, so hitting the equivalent of Ctrl-C, Ctrl-S, etc., is very difficult. Unless I can train myself to hit Command with the thumb on the opposite side of the keyboard from the "s" or "c" or "x," or "z," I don't think I'm going to be able to touch-type the Mac equivalents for commands I've used without thinking in Windows. So I'm having to be overly conscious of the keyboard now.The Delete key on the Mac is really the Backspace key from Windows; there is no Delete key. Maybe there is a way to delete a character to the right of the cursor as easily as pressing the Delete key in Windows, but I haven't discovered it yet. I did discover that Command-Right Arrow goes to the end of the line and Command-Left Arrow goes to the start of the line, so there are probably other keyboard shortcuts I just have to find and learn.The Mac, like Windows, has many of its own keyboard shortcuts, but I had to go hunting online for what the cryptic symbols for the various keys are...only to keep forgetting them. Which makes me wonder why Apple could not have put the iconic representation on the major keys like it did with the Command key. They have printed "alt" on top of the Option key, which will help Windows users making the transition, but the Mac symbol for Option is not on the key. Maybe there's a way to pop up a graphic representation of a key, but I haven't found it yet.I set my Dashboard to the left and adjusted the size so my desktop feels familiar to me. I'm a bit frustrated that I don't quite understand the file structure yet, and I'm still trying to get used to the placement of the in-focus program's menu. But this is a learning curve I'm committed to going through, because it's worth it to me to be able to get away from Windows.All this is to say that, if you are a Windows user considering making the switch, the price is now right to do it, but you're probably going to want a good book. These have been recommended to me by a very knowledgeable person on the Apple forums:Mac OS X Lion: The Missing ManualMac OS X Lion Bibleand also the Switch 101 at Apple's Home/Support.I am really happy with this baby.

Reviews.Title: Glad I switched to Mac!!
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I never thought i would buy a Mac.  I looked into this Macbook Pro and was blown away.  I love everything about this laptop.  It does take a little getting used to if you are not familiar with a Mac, but its cake and worth the extra money.  Macs last longer and are just amazing!  I got my new laptop a few days after I ordered it and have been using it nonstop.  FYI- definitely get a hard case cover and keyboard cover to protect your new baby.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jayson
Reviews.Content: Everything going well since I placed the order, I'm very happy with my mac book pro, now I recommend this product!!! :D

Reviews.Title: look did not change, but the inside did
Reviews.Author: Vicente
Reviews.Content: This new sandy bridge is a lot faster and more powerful. I love the speed for video editing, it really helps when you are converting data and compressing video.

Reviews.Title: Best Laptop I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: I used PC's all throughout college and law school, and they always had all sorts of horrible problems.  My last computer was literally in pieces by the time I was done with it.  The MacBook Pro is made of much better stuff than the cheap plastic most PC laptops are made out of, and the software suite is pretty awesome compared to what you get standard with Windows.  I've also found this computer to be quite fast for all of my purposes, including recording music using Logic.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous!
Reviews.Author: P. Ernst
Reviews.Content: My first MacBook Pro. Been a Mac user since my first Mac, a Mac Plus back in the late 80's. Owned many Macs since then, this is the best yet. Gorgeous screen, nice battery life. very speedy. Love it!

Reviews.Title: MacBook pro 2011
Reviews.Author: Khoa
Reviews.Content: Great laptop that is well worth the price. And don't forget that any mac bought on amazon is qualified to receive the new lion osx, through apple up to date program. The cons are that there isn't anything great about the thunderbolt port.

Reviews.Title: The Top of the Line
Reviews.Author: Tejit
Reviews.Content: I got mine preinstalled with Microsoft Office and bought a time capsule also.It's amazing. It is extremely fast at processing,the operating system is amazing, the trackpad is really convenient, and the graphics are great.  Quick start up, and it will open a whole new world that windows locks away with windows 7. If you can afford it and need a laptop for college, high school or business,  this the one for you. Only a few cons:Its graphics could be 1080p and it could have a blu-ray.Tip: Get it with Microsoft Word for Mac.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Apple Macbook Pro
Reviews.Author: V. Satish Kumar
Reviews.Content: An awesome product. Though I am not a Apple fan, I love this product for its quality, its build, and the features supported by it.

Reviews.Title: Love my MacBook Pro
Reviews.Author: Marcus Hedlund
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my MacBook Pro. Will never go back to a windows computer. The MacBook is so fast and easy to use. Never locks up and needs to be rebooted. Display is so much better the my previous windows computers. It was kind of expensive, but so far worth it.

Reviews.Title: Best laptop ever
Reviews.Author: Omar Torres Munoz "Omar.tm"
Reviews.Content: Ok so I bought the macbook pro at the apple store and I have always wanted one, iv had it for 3 months now and i have not had a single problem. For starters i love the keyboard and its screen is just the best. Now lets talk specs ok the 4GB of memory is good and fast the hard drive space is really good compared to my previous laptop wich was a dell inspiron the i think they dont make anymore. I dont know about the games too much though i play the sims 3 and it works good. ohhh one more thing i like about it is that it dosnt take forever to start up. :)

Reviews.Title: Convenient MAC
Reviews.Author: D. Alfiche
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Mac I bought and I love it.  My first one lasted a lot longer than I expected so I was ready for a new one.  I dont have anything negative to say about my Mac.

Reviews.Title: Apple MacBook Pro MC700LL/A 13.3-inch laptop
Reviews.Author: k.stephens
Reviews.Content: Wonderful!  Shipped when it said it would.  Love the MacBook Pro!  I am very happy I switched from a PC.  It is easy to use, the screen is beautiful, and does everything I need and more.

Reviews.Title: Best machine
Reviews.Author: paulisima
Reviews.Content: I've been with Apple a while ago, and decided to update with a pro machine, more now that I work with DAW (digital audio worksation) and I could't ask for something better, do not hesitate on buying this.

Reviews.Title: This is my first Mac..I'm confused about all the fuss
Reviews.Author: L. Esp.. "LE IN LV"
Reviews.Content: ....I own many ipod's and an Ipad...I am a PC user...I have a Qosmio gaming computer and a Toshiba with an i7 processor....This was an impulse buy...When people talk about Mac's its like they found the most perfect thing on earth...When I ask if they've ever tried windows 7 all they say is forget about windows as Mac is far superior..If  you are trying to compare an old XP or Vista to your newer Apple, they are not comparable....Understand that I am new  to Apple OS and trying to learn this operating system with  little help....PROs  I love processors so the i5 was a huge selling point for me...The machine runs very quickly and smoothly ***but that is the i5 processor in action***....It turns off and on quickly ...Is light weight with only OK  battery life....no defrag (which never really bothered me) and no viruses (I've never gotten a virus that Norton or Kaspersky didn't handle immediately..The  keys are backlit and have a nice feel to them.....YES I AM NEW TO THIS SYSTEM but I have found many things that make me prefer The Windows 7 operating system...The Mac operating system is not as easy as people will have you think...It certainly is Pricey though... So are all the apps and everything else you might want to use...Apple is hole for dumping money into...The machine is a wonderful web surfer but that's as far as I will go...I have had little luck with the IPhotos...several site will not work with Mac..I Miss the wonderful task bar on windows 7 ..The DOC on a mac is a nuisance and has a childlike look to it....Maybe I expected more after hearing people sing Macs praises over and over again... I will use it but I will certainly use my windows 7 PC's every bit as much... I'm not a pro musician or videographer just a computer user....I notice that something in windows takes one move and some things in Mac require several moves ..I'm sure i'll hear a lot of negative comments but It's just not the end all be all of computing like people will have you believe...As far as fast goes, any i3/i5/i7 intel processor in any half way decent machine will be fast.....I am being honest...if you are happy with Windows 7 you need look no further...On a different note  ... I am happy  with the iPad...Now that is worth owning and tons of fun*****UPDATE****** I use it to surf the internet every day and I've opened and looked at all the systems......I managed to accidentally and easily delete System preferences with is the equivalent of Control Panel..The Best Buy GS service guy didn't really know how to put it back but his information was correct (use the first recovery disc) ... I love the quick start up and shut down but, I feel windows 7 is a better and easier operating system and does not impose the limits that Apple does..**** CHANGE OF HEART****  PLEASE READ MY LAST COMENT ******

Reviews.Title: 2011 Macbook Pro 13.3 i5
Reviews.Author: Kapitalist
Reviews.Content: I owned a macbook before I went today (3/14/11) and bought this macbook pro.  Heres a quick run me down:Previous: Macbook, intel core 2 duo, 2.4ghz, 4 GB ddr2, 350gb hdWorked great for 3 years (of course I upgraded it through new egg when I purchased it).Current Macbook pro, i5, 2.3ghz, 4gb ddr3, 320gb hd.So far, I notice a significant increase in speed and power.  I purchased an 8gb kit which should be coming soon.  My Windows 7 vm will fly now....unlike on my macbook...which lagged heavily.Overall the reason for my switch was Battery life, cpu improvement, memory expansion, design, and resale value of my previous macbook ($500). Plus I got a graduate student discount.Once I went mac, I was sold on Apple products.  Definitely a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Love my Macbook Pro
Reviews.Author: D. A. Wells
Reviews.Content: My wife bought me this new model, I ruined my other one when I spilled tea on it (it was last year's model). I think this one is even faster running, which didn't seem possible.I would actually give this a 4.9 out of 5 if I could, because the graphics are not quite as bright with the integrated graphics rather than the separate card. It's not really that big a deal for me, since I really don't do graphics design or anything, but if you do that would be something to consider. I still love it though, and will never, ever go back to a PC.

Reviews.Title: Best Laptop On The Market!
Reviews.Author: M. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I just upgraded from a late 2006 Macbook and couldn't be happier!  I loved my original Macbook and enjoyed using it for the past five years and the only reason I upgraded to the new MBP was that my display on my original Macbook had begun to deteriorate and the battery sucked.  Macs last a long time though, and I'm looking forward to many years with this one.  This laptop, above any others, is just downright beautiful.  I have never seen such craftsmanship and sexiness in a computer before.  It is a joy to own.  I encourage any with the money to pick up on of the 2011 model MBPs and see for yourself!  The new processors are amazingly fast and this 13 inch core i5 is more than I'll ever need!

Reviews.Title: My first Mac
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: My first Mac after many years Windows and various Unix based OSes (Linux, Solaris).I am absolutely stunned at quality of the hardware and easy of use of this Mac  - yes I wish it could cost less, but it's no more expensive than comparable Windoz based laptop.Pros:design, quality, look, polished in every department, excellent Unix based OS - stable, fast, great battery life, stunning display especially of its size, seamless configuration of everything - wireless, mail, network, free upgrade to Mac OS X Lion.Cons:it's not really Mac's fault but adjusting to a track pad with no buttons takes some time - I should blame that on Windoz really, as buttons don't really make much sense.it'd be great if the screen was anti-glareUpdate: have to reduce to 3 stars - Mac really likes memory, with some basic software development tools, mail and browser it goes close to 4G of used memory and starts paging to disk heavily, slowing down dramatically! Didn't expect that from a Unix based system, I think Apple needs to work on memory efficiency (look at Linux!), otherwise Mac will end up where Windoz now is - deep memory sucking hole.Another problem is some desktop widgets have serious memory leaks, I had to kill whole dashboard to release 1G of lost memory after a week of use.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed on my 1st Macbook Pro
Reviews.Author: bonnfree
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Macbook Pro 5 months ago (June 2011) and have it updated immediately to OSx Lion after it's release last July.Last November 7, I opted to have my Mac 5 software updates in the office since the internet connection at home is painfully slow.Earlier before the update, I was using it as normal and no sign of saying goodbye to me.As usual, I plugged my Mac though it still about 20% battery full. I left it for more than 30 minutes and I was shocked to see a non-stop static screen when I came back.I waited for a few minutes for it to stop but it won't so I press the power button until it shut down.It won't boot up after an attempt but the lid on the front that indicates sleep mode is still there and my Mac is heating up so bad.This is the first time that my Mac has heaten up this bad!Boot it up after a few minutes and dismayed that it won't boot up again.The apple icon was loading during startup but it will eventually lead to a black screen with yellow line on the right side.It is frustrating! It is only just 5 months old and I love my Mac so much that I am very much careful not to overcharged it or anything.I have it checked on a PowerMac center and was told that they will have the parts replaced for free whatever the defective part is and was instructed to follow up after a week. 2.5 weeks later I was informed that they have requested the parts to Apple already for replacement as part of the 1 year limited warranty of Apple. Now, after 3 weeks, I am still waiting of when my Macbook Pro will be back. I am very disappointed that this has happen in only 5 months time.Barely a month after I sent it to the PowerMac service center, my Macbook has been fixed and was told that the whole logic board has been replaced. When asked what was the possible reason for the circuit deficiency, they did not gave an exact answer since the technician did not tell what has been the problem. I ask the Solutions team and the closest answer I got was due to the firmware update that was not installed properly.

Reviews.Title: great computer
Reviews.Author: royd
Reviews.Content: OK, I haven't drunk the kool-aid.  I was a long time Windows user who needed a feature (firewire) on a laptop that seems to no longer be available on windows laptops while it is available on the Macbook Pro.  So I bought the Apple.  It is a great computer - very well made, with excellent components.  Some of the differences in the platform are just that, different ways of doing the same thing.  I do not experience the Mac as better, more intuitive, or easier.  There are some things that are clearly more difficult to do on the Apple and the tweaking and flexibility that I enjoyed on the Windows computers is either very difficult or not available.  OTOH, the way that everything works together is nice.So, it is a great computer at a premium price.  apples or oranges?  you choose.

Reviews.Title: It just works
Reviews.Author: Brian Beagle "Beagle"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Mac.  I purchased it because I wanted to develop for the iPhone/iPad.  Little did I know that it would also make my wife happy as I was able to upload photos that she had been on me about for some time.  iPhoto with its facial recognition is just amazing.  I had about 5,000 pictures to go through, but they seem to go pretty fast for the main part (identify a face and location if i wish).  My next adventure will be iMovie for creating family movies.I've done some learning with it as well with iTunesU.  I've only seemed to confuse the MacBook pro a couple of times, but for the most part it just works and does it very well.  Thank you Apple for making a solid product.

Reviews.Title: Mac vs pc wins
Reviews.Author: eric
Reviews.Content: Me being a pc guy and buying a Mac only for doing I kept the Mac for 2 years and still had my gaming pc I gotcsick and tired of the Mac and really do not like it socicsoldnit and bought my self a custom build pc I mean macs are way to overpriced and only 500gigs deff pc over Mac

Reviews.Title: I love my macbook.
Reviews.Author: Jose Ramirez
Reviews.Content: It's so good. Very fast, it came with windows office and pages. I love it so much. you should get one too

Reviews.Title: Will break, New macbooks are downgrades.
Reviews.Author: Brandon Green
Reviews.Content: Better than a PC, but apple's customer care sucks if you don't live near an apple store. Since it was 2 years old my macbook has been losing power even when plugged in. So even if you have a power source, you can't expect to get more than a few hours a day out of the damn thing. Add to that the fact that Mountain Lion tries to hide the battery problems, requiring you to use third-party software to even see how much time you have left.Would just buy a new one, but my old one is better than the new, unupgradeable, unrepairable pieces of crap they're trying to sell. So disappointed in Apple.

Reviews.Title: Good product, horrible Apple Customer Service!!!
Reviews.Author: tkeiks
Reviews.Content: Macbook was okay- I'm assuming. Didn't get a chance to open the package as I was in the process of moving (homes)when it was delivered. When I finally had time, I realized it didn't come with a power adapter (the portion connecting the computer to the cord that is inserted into an outlet was missing). Call the Apple manufacturer and was told i had to pay for a replacement, as it was after a few weeks and I should have called within a few days. I was upset, angry- especially since the individual was rude. Never again will I purchase a Mac!

Reviews.Title: A+++
Reviews.Author: PinVee05
Reviews.Content: "The computer has arrived as scheduled and was in perfect condition. I am very happy with the quality of the product."

Reviews.Title: Love the product, hate the restrictions
Reviews.Author: Bels "Bels"
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are an ardent Apple faithful and cant read any of Apple's drawbacks, please do not read the review. There are hundreds of 5 star reviews here, feel happy to read them instead. I'm just doing my part of an unbiased review:Before I proceed:----------------I've been a PC guy since the time I saw my first computer. I have used various MS OS's before jumping to Mac. I owned (and still do) other Apple devices and have a built an Apple eco-system myself.On to the product review: One star (*) is negative and three stars are indicative of positive comment.*** Mac experience starts right from the time you start unpacking your box. There is attention provided at each detail of the packaging as well and its very impressive.*** MBP gives you a feel of the money you have spent. I know by experience why Apple users have pride in owning these devices.*** My Mac experience has been very good, in terms of boot up speed, reliability and ease of operation. I must say, since I'm moving from Windows 7 OS, any better experience will feel great.*** Multi-touch gesture is excellent and all imitations I have come across with MS vendors so far seem to be cheap compared to Apple experience.* Keyboard really looks cheap. In fact, the caps lock key is half responsive right out of the box. Call me insane for NOT returning the product for this reason alone, after trying to get through it for 2-3 weeks! I didn't want this one key burden to be passed on to Amazon.com.* My primary purpose of selecting MBP as against MBAir was for the optical drive. Apple provided iLife for free and pre-installed. I acknowledge that. But they deliberately dropped the iDVD from this package. I scrambled around for first few days to write some of my home videos to a disc, which wont play in my DVD player. I have my near ones, who can only watch videos in DVD player. I wrote to Amazon.com on this problem. Like always, received a response from them in no time and they suggested me to contact Apple first. I called the Apple customer care number. I had done some homework on Apple support forums and knew there were a few people who received iLife disc for this problem. When my call was answered by Apple, I got such a horrible customer support, I was rudely told Apple no longer supports iDVD and I need to purchase the full iLife s/w package just for iDVD! What crap!! I promptly got the ticket number and contacted back Amazon.com with this concern. Amazon.com is always amazing and helped me with their 5 star service (wont mention the resolution here).I just wonder if I purchase Apple Care protection plan, will I sign up for this same arrogant crap from Apple for my dollars? Rotten Apple needs to address this arrogance.* I'm having tough time selecting software for my needs. Though I was aware there are not enough s/w available for Mac (as compared to MS), didnt know I have to shell out for each small thing I want to do. Apple boasts of half a million apps for iOS devices, free+paid. I wish they could have done equally well on the Mac s/w front. I guess it is their adamant 30% cut and the closely controlled OS platform that keeps people away from writing s/w for Mac platform. No easy s/w, no virus and the latter is advertised. Nice isn't it?* Keyboard shortcuts are not as user friendly as MS. There are several shortcuts that I'm used to and I feel improve my productivity and they are lacking in Mac. But some of these shortcomings are masked with the excellent multi-touch gesture support provided in MBP.* MBP has a critical Hard disk failure issue. I was horrified to see how many people have complained this issue in Apple forum and were denied free service by Apple. I read this a week before I bought mine, but decided to gamble with my luck. Sacred to handle it in any rough way for this reason, and delicate machines dont qualify to be rated high.Overall, I'm happy with the product and the way it has been built around the Apple eco-system, but don't think it qualifies for 5 stars. There are shortcomings that Apple needs to address (and I know, profit centric Apple wont).Again, I want to re-iterate that the Apple customer support that I received is not even near 1% to the amazing customer support that Amazon.com provides. Apple is really arrogant and is trying to bend the customers to squeeze the money out of their pocket, while keeping quite on their product issues. They are also forcing the customers to adapt to their profit centric approach for future, by dropping s/w support to the hardware they are currently offering (iDVD vs optical drive). Getting away from optical drive is not for optimizing the battery and reduce weight as they claim, but to impress the media industry and lure them to open up the DRM content into iTunes. iCloud wont bring rains. Its just about shadow (shady) business.

Reviews.Title: Just what i expected
Reviews.Author: Israel Muñoz
Reviews.Content: What can i say that hasn't been said already... You get what you pay for... Excellent build quality, and it has worked great so far

Reviews.Title: Amazon sells outdated products
Reviews.Author: Ferdie L.
Reviews.Content: When I was looking this item up at amazon before making the purchase nothing in amazons postings said that the item was an OLD VERSION.  I thought I was buying from a reputable company and was buying the LATEST VERSION.  Low and behold I am now told by amazon that the item I just bought is an OLD VERSION.  Why would one purchase an OLD VERSION for the same price as the LATEST VERSION.  Buyers beware specially when shopping at amazon.

Reviews.Title: Owned it for 3 years -- Zero issues
Reviews.Author: Mateen
Reviews.Content: I've had this model for about 3 years now without any problems. The battery died on me after its natural life (6 months back) so I went to the Apple store to purchase a new one. They replaced it for free! ($130 value)

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: jser0
Reviews.Content: Best laptop ever, i was afraid on the change from pc to mac, but now i can say that it worth it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: meemee
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love my MacBook Pro! I was a pc user prior to this and I am so glad I made the switch!

Reviews.Title: Its a MAC after all
Reviews.Author: Arit Ghosh "Arts"
Reviews.Content: So far in the Mac Vs. Windows war .... I now have changed sides to the Mac advocate!!This is truly a machine that defines ease of operation and a different level of intuitive computing. Everything about this computer stands out.If you are shifting from the Windows to OSx system don't be intimidated .... rather embrace this opportunity towards greatness!

Reviews.Title: Best computer I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: TradingHeroes dot Com "Hugh"
Reviews.Content: I work in IT Consulting and have used Windows PCs for years.  In the past, I have never really given Macs a second thought because they were expensive and didn't run any of the programs that I needed.But recently, I started using my girlfriend's MacBook Pro 17.  What I discovered was that Macs have really grown up.  For those programs that you really do need Windows, VMWare Fusion works really well.  For the most part however OS X has almost everything that most people will need.  The software is just so simple and makes sense.What I love is that everything works like it is supposed to.  It feels like a real computer.  When you use a PC after using a Mac, the PC feels like a toy.In addition, Windows just keeps on getting more and more complicated.  Simple tasks feel like they are getting ready to launch a nuclear missile or something.So I decided to replace all of my Windows PCs (3) with this one MBP 13.  I am so happy that I did.  The body is solid, the keyboard layout makes typing really easy.  The screen is really sharp and the power supply is so small and light.  The power supplies on my previous PC laptops were so big and bulky.My only complaints are that it is a little on the heavier side and that the stock hard drive is a little small.  But it's not any heavier than laptops I have had in the past.The performance is really snappy with the 4MB of RAM.  In the near future, I'm going to upgrade the computer to a 1TB hard drive and 8MB RAM.Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great Computer
Reviews.Author: Mr T
Reviews.Content: I love this computer in every way but one. The edge of the computer in front of the track pad is rather sharp. When I use the amazing trackpad for an extended period of time, it can become pretty uncomfortable to my right hand as it has to rest on the edge. If that edge were only rounded off a bit, it would be the perfect computer. When I follow the steps for conditioning the battery, I can get almost 10 hours out of it! Love this computer!

Reviews.Title: Happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Buttons11
Reviews.Content: Received my computer on time.  I did have to go to the UPS Shipping and pick it up because it was delivered when I was not home and Amazon needed a signature for it.  I still received it the same day it was delivered.  Just had to call UPS and they called me back when the driver returned to the shipping center.  Packaged very well, in three different boxes.  Opened it up and was up and running in about a half hour.  I did have a little problem installing the Adobe Flash player but after installing the new apps and restart the computer it work just fine.  I have worked on one at work so I have a little help.  Apple is different then a PC, but I think I am going to like this.  I am only giving this a 4 star because I have only had it one day.

Reviews.Title: Ended up going back to a Windows 7 Laptop.
Reviews.Author: Eggplant Pete
Reviews.Content: [Original Review]I have been a PC user all of my life. As I've gotten a bit older I find that I need a laptop more often than a Gaming Desktop. I considered getting a gaming notebook, but none of them have a decent battery and most have quite a few issues with heat and durability.I decided to go for the new Mac Pro after seeing the specs and hearing rave reviews of older models from friends. I'm so glad that I did! The one PC game I couldn't make it without(Starcraft II) works just fine on OSX as well as in Parallels.I am a web developer so I've heard from friends in the field about how nice the Mac software is compared to Windows equivalents. (I tried Coda and absolutely love it!) There are several programs that I've switched to that are as good if not better than the Windows counterparts.The construction of the MBP is outstanding. It feels incredibly sturdy and capable of lasting the tides of time.Overall, I'm extremely impressed. I've always felt that calling something expensive meant that you didn't agree that the value was worth the cost.If anything the Mac is undervalued based on what I've experienced![1st Edit]I've now had the Mac for a little over 2 months. I'm still as crazy about it as I was when I purchased it. If you are considering it and have the money, it's well worth it and hasn't had any kind of instability or hiccups![2nd Edit]I decided to sell the Mac and go back to Windows. This machine was too slow for me.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Herbcat
Reviews.Content: Simply put, the best Mac I've ever owned.I love how light it is, how bright it is, how it replaced my 15" MBP from 2006 without a hitch.I love the way the keyboard clicks. The way the trackpad clicks.  It's a work of art. :)

Reviews.Title: No FREE upgrade to Lion
Reviews.Author: Mark "It's not about guns, It's about freedom"
Reviews.Content: Could have received a free upgrade Lion because I purchased it July 27 & Lion was released July 21. But Apple only honor it if you take advantage of it within the first 30 days. I think I should still get the Lion upgrade for free if I purchased it within the first 30 days of its release no matter how long before I take advantage of it. Got screwed APPLE!

Reviews.Title: Do Yourself a Favor, Buy a PC
Reviews.Author: K. L. Olson
Reviews.Content: I have been very disappointed with my Macbook Pro.  It is very unstable for connecting to WiFi.  I keep getting the Self-Assigned IP address.  Google self assigned IP address and you will see that many others are getting the same problem.  It is a problem that Mac refuses to address.  I have tried all the solutions suggested, and non have fixed the problem.  Mac support has not solved the problem either.  They claim it is the WiFi routers.  No way.This is my second Mac.  I bought a Macbook back in 2007.  Although there are some nice features on Mac computers, the cons outweigh them all.If you are thinking about jumping from PC to Mac, I suggest you reconsider.

Reviews.Title: Best laptop ever
Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: I'm gonna make it short and simple, mostly because that's all it needs to be. The Macbook Pro 13 in. is the best laptop I've ever had in my life hands down. It's amazing. The screen is bright and definitely shows all the little details. Looks smooth and clear. The basic structure of the computer is amazing, breathtaking even. But maybe that's just because I'm an apple fan. And I especially love the fact that the keyboard is backlit if you want it to be, and you can choose how bright you want it to be. But the only downside is that the keyboard starts getting that shiny look after you type alot on it. But every keyboard does eventually so that's not only specific to this computer.

Reviews.Title: Waiting With Anticipation
Reviews.Author: Dan Surf "hvac man"
Reviews.Content: Been doing PC/Windows for last 20 years. Its been nice, now Im ready for a change, ordered the Mac Book Pro 13.5,it was hard to decide between Mac Air and Pro, but decided on Pro since I hold on to laptops long and would like to do eventual upgrades. Heard nothing but good reviews on MAC Book Pro so I will let you know soon. One main reason I got Mac was hopefully this will be great quality, Im tired of so so. But as of now I give 5 stars mostly because I like Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Best Brand of laptops out there
Reviews.Author: Yang
Reviews.Content: One of the best laptops out there, windows can go die. seriously look at how fast apple is taking over the pc market, its Apple domination from here on out

Reviews.Title: Replacement
Reviews.Author: W. Tobias
Reviews.Content: Replaced earlier version destroyed by spill.  Time Machine Restore worked perfectly including the Windows partition.  Like our PC's--Love our Macs

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: S. Chatterjee
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time PC user who always ranted about Mac lovers being spoiled brats who needed pretty things that didn't justify their price. Well, when my old PC died on me because of a virus, I was so mad with Windows I forgot all my past ravings and went over to the Mac side.It took me a little time to get adjusted to the Mac, but the computer is great. It's powerful, perfectly sized, with great battery life (maybe not the advertised 7 hours) and yes, a million times better looking than any PC laptop.I still prefer certain things about Windows, but maybe I haven't gotten to know my Mac well enough.The only complaint would be that Amazon took its sweet time delivering.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: lucas
Reviews.Content: well, I never really got the computer, because I had to return it (I live in Brazil and couldn't get the product here), but Amazon did everything as they said. the only problem is that they took really long to refund me.. so this MacBook is still in my wishlist.. let's see if I can get it next month. BUY IT!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: LK
Reviews.Content: I got the MacPro for my wife. she is loving it. Purchase experience through Amazon was good. It turned out to be $100 cheaper than bestbuy finally

Reviews.Title: Simple Review
Reviews.Author: Arealist
Reviews.Content: I solid buy definitely one of the best laptop on the market.If you want a Mac you will love it and it offers a strong overall performance.The bad is the battery life is pretty good not amazing as advertised by some and the screen is very good not great if I have to nit pick.

Reviews.Title: works but missing software
Reviews.Author: Randall E. Iden "Home shopper"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a "like new" computer from Amazon's marketplace.  The computer is in good shape but was missing the iLife software suite which is supposed to be included on all new Macs.  Amazon has not been helpful in rectifying this.

Reviews.Title: deidson review
Reviews.Author: Ymcadon
Reviews.Content: purchased this computer for my grandson who is going away to college this fall.i checked with him before writing this review and found that he is very fond of this gift.I am a apple computer owner and know how well they work.We are very satisified with this computer. I want to thank Amazon for thier support and friendly personell who helped me allot.

Reviews.Title: It's so shiny!!!
Reviews.Author: AnnaV
Reviews.Content: A Mac is a Mac :) it's fast, advanced, user-friendly, slim, elegant... All of my expectation were met and even exceeded, I only used it for a day, but hope to say after some time that I'm not gonna change to an ordinary PC ever again.Great delivery by amazon - fast, direct, efficient :)

Reviews.Title: this great laptop
Reviews.Author: dwi elfrida
Reviews.Content: this is great laptop, and amazon packaged it very well, on time delivery and their price is cheaper than other seller.Apple MacBook Pro MC700LL/A 13.3-Inch Laptop

Reviews.Title: VERY good!!!
Reviews.Author: KK "KK"
Reviews.Content: Without comment, the Macbook Pro is the best computer in the world.No mistake. Everything is perfect.In my house are three Macbook Pro and never will use PC.Is there life before and after the MAC:)

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Laseru
Reviews.Content: Pro:No laptop compares to this. The build quality and the feeling when you use it has no match.Con:Heavy for the size (not a big issue)OS X with 4 gb of ram freezes in some situations.. not expecting that but still not a great issue. Usually with VLC happens that when playing 9GB HD file.Very good!!!

Reviews.Title: Fast, thin and light, great battery, ultimate style
Reviews.Author: William A. Sloan
Reviews.Content: There will always be less expensive notebooks out there, but Apple continues to provide laptops that look dead sexy and have enough power to back their looks up.  Could I have found a Windows computer with comparable or better specs for less money?  Yes.  Would it have been as insanely sleek as the Macbook Pro with the battery life to match the MBP?  Absolutely not.  Buy an extended battery to get 7 hours of battery life out of your HP lappy and it becomes twice as thick and close to twice as heavy.  With no aluminum unibody.The only drawback is of course that the battery is not removable, so you could probably buy two normal sized batteries for a Windows computer and swap them, but your still having to carry something extra to achieve the battery life.  I am happy with the battery life I get on it and since Ive never owned a second battery for a laptop anyway i don't feel like I'm missing out.Also, just a sidenote, the reported battery life for the new Macbooks is only 7 hours wheras before they were reporting 10.  I'm happy to report that my 2011 MBP gets as long of life as my Dad's 1mo old 2010 MBP.  I read from a few different sources that Apple is testing the batteries using a more realistic method.  I have gotten about eight hours out of it so far.Pros:StyleThin and LightLong Battery LifeHD webcam"chiclet" keyboard (this is pretty subjective though)durable aluminum unibody (when they initially came out with this style in 2008 I thought it sounded gimmicky, but it is actually a solid way to build a laptop)giant trackpadCons:non swappable batteryprice stayed the same as 2010 model.  I was kinda hoping they would come down a little bit now that they have had plenty of time to perfect manufacturing processes/quality"glass" trackpad and screen (really some kind of compound material) can crack if you do something stupid, but just dont abuse the computer and it will be fine

Reviews.Title: Good build. Terrible speakers, keyboard and value.
Reviews.Author: David Pat

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: I. karim "Honeybooboochile"
Reviews.Content: after having my macbook air 2011 stolen by my  roomate, i had to get a mac again but couldnt shell out the cash for another air so i just got this and i hope to love it as much even more so,i will review the actual product soon.

Reviews.Title: Hate this computer
Reviews.Author: M. Olson "mo"
Reviews.Content: It's official I hate my macbook Pro.  I bought this computer over a year ago and I wanted to wait to write a review until I had given myself time to adapt to it.  My question now is why did I want to .  I admit I was drawn into the Apple hype.  The promises of better, faster,safer, easier computer use.  The thoughts of using iPhoto, which "sucks" by the way,  sorry.  The Mac makes most things more challenging if you are trying to use Microsoft word.  I have to redo every document I create on  a PC before I can file it.  Before you say anything I did try to get help on line and in person at an apple store to resolve the issues but Hmmm. no one could explain it.  Go figure.  I will keep it until it dies, which alas, may be a while,  but I will never buy another.  Give me a PC any day.  Besides with the strides others are making there's not much that warrants an apple purchase anymore anyway.

Reviews.Title: Expensive razor,expensive blades
Reviews.Author: James S. Kelley "bogwood"
Reviews.Content: The mechanics of the MacBook have been reasonable.  The software, for this mostly routine user has been frustrating.During the five years there have been new OS to leopard, snow leopard and lion.  I am perfectly happy with the original tiger which is now poorly supported.  Printers for instance are now mostly requiring at least Leopard.  Changes are not trouble free.  Parallel (to use microsoft occasionally) was more trouble than it was worth.I am now 2 mac 2 dell household and finding the Dells more practical.  There are features like changing mag on the text which work better on the Mac.  Do not pay up to be a cult member. Watch out for expensive razor blades for your expensive razor.

Reviews.Title: HEY! its a MAC!
Reviews.Author: B. enterprises "bc world"
Reviews.Content: Better than last years model!Pros: Faster more Powerful processor (excellent i5 processor!)  Better battery life.Cons: The graphics are not as good as last year model but still good.  I wanted a upgrade in resolution but, its still okay.Overall:  I have been using macs for a while (all different types) The MBP 2011 2.3 is excellent.Quote "I would rather have an OLD MAC, than a NEW PC." by......... meE-N-D.

Reviews.Title: In reach for perfection. A true dream machine.
Reviews.Author: Freddy Sallent "Freddy Sallent"
Reviews.Content: I've always been a PC user my whole life. Always bought VAIO's and TOSHIBAs which are both very nice, very fast and with very crisp screens but...  There is nothing, nothing, NOTHING out there that can compare to this MAC. I did not even wanted to be a MAC user myself but if you haven't tried one out, please do before buying into a new laptop. True, is more expensive than most, but just ask yourself WHY?? Good stuff never comes cheap. No? compare speed, performance, OS X vs Windows... There is no possible way to compare them!!! Thinking to buy a new computer, get a MAC... everything else it's just a screen and a keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Great Investment.
Reviews.Author: A.D.
Reviews.Content: I went to my local Apple store yesterday to buy this computer. My god, am I glad that I spent my money on this. I definitely give it a 10/10. If you're planning to buy a computer, BUY A MAC. Trust me, it will be worth your money. It doesn't matter where you get it either Apple store or Amazon, but get a mac!!!

Reviews.Title: I "went mac" and I am heading back!
Reviews.Author: John Skupien
Reviews.Content: After nearly a month on a Macbook Pro 13" I have officially decided I am not a mac person.  The low review is mostly for the shortcomings of using a Mac in the business world.  Having just missed two appointments and learning that my calendar was not (and cannot!) syncing Outlook for Mac 2011.  Being very comfortable with  windows and reliant upon office I have been using a hybrid approach to office.  I installed windows using VM fuse on a virtual machine and it was slow and caused confusion over which copy of outlook I should be using.  Further more formatting problems between documents created using office for Mac and windows proved way to annoying.Bottom line is that I am sure the macbook pro is great for someone in the creative field.  It is not for those who are in business and rely on products such as office.Enough venting on why not mac.The computer,Keyboard- pro--comfortable to type on  con lousy selection of wireless extended keyboardsCamera/skye --very clear and adjusted to lighting differences nicely con- nonespeed --slow at times especially when using windows on virtual machineUSB 3.0 --oops forgot to put this in.  Accidentally put in some other Thunderbolt connection...good for external monitor...but what else?Fingerprint password option--not here and not good (secure) on any mac.Overall quality is nice, but, for the price think it is more Steve Jobs hype.

Reviews.Title: Designs = 5, Value = 2
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: This thing is a beauty! It is BMW of laptops or Mercedes, Ferrari, whatever you want to call it. It's drop dead gorgeous. Let's use the car metaphor, unlike the exotic cars which have special engineered super power engine to justifies the high price. This Macbook pro's engine is similar to one found in not so exotic PC laptops such as Acer Aspire TimelineX AS3830T-6870 13.3-Inch Aluminum Laptop (Cobalt Blue), which cost $400 - $500 less. These days, computer components are very similar in performance and quality, because most of them are made by the same factories in China. The only differences is the case design and OS, is it worth the extra $500? That's for you to decide.This beauty feels very slow, because it uses a 5400 RPM hard drive instead of 7200 RPM drive, and I'm used to SSD speed on my PCs. Other than that, it's a laptop like all others. It's what you do with it that matters.

Reviews.Title: Amazon delivers again
Reviews.Author: S. Bowen "***sbee***"
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that Amazon simply rocks. Items took literally 8 hrs to be delivered and as usual extremely well packaged.Now unto the MBP itself, one word......... FAST.Do not hesitate to buy this and make sure you buy it from amazon
